DataElement.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Pathologist Feedback Report Submission Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date on which this version of the Procurement Feedback Report was submitted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Pathologist Feedback Report Submission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs)._Pathologist is a doctor specialized in medical diagnosis based on the macroscopic and microscopic study of structural changes of tissues and organs caused by the disease._An evaluative response to an inquiry, process, event, or activity._A short textual account; having provided a short account._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs).:Pathologist is a doctor specialized in medical diagnosis based on the macroscopic and microscopic study of structural changes of tissues and organs caused by the disease.

Concepts.definition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs).
Any physician whose career is devoted to the study of pathology.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
